content:
In table view, click on the date in the column heading.

Or use the View menu > sort by.

In Windows, you may have to press <alt> to see the menu bar.

content:
The settings are not at the ...default-esr\settingsgs location

Let's start with where you are. You have installed thunderbird. Have you set up an account yet? Tell us where you are in the setup process and we can go from there. The goal is to get one email account working. i will refrain from more questions until you reply.

content: My assumption is that you have the account defined twice. True? Are you wanting to receive messages twice, or is the POP account left over from switching to IMAP? Maybe I am misunderstanding and need a clearing explanation on your setup. Thank you

creator: Steve72

content: - Make sure that cookies are accepted, as selected in settings>privacy&security' - click settings>general and check that the experimental setup option is NOT set (see attached) - click the new account>email menu and enter name, email address and nothing else (do NOT enter password) - click DONE and there should appear a Gmail prompt for password
creator: davidsk

content: It's a fixed bug which hasn't landed yet. Until it does, disable automatic compacting.

content: You can find The Messaging Company's mail settings here. You can then (in Thunderbird) go to Account Settings -> your email address -> Edit outgoing server to change the SMTP settings and Account Settings -> your email address -> Server Settings to change the IMAP settings.

content:
Account Error: "Could not send username. Response from mail server pop.do7.enjoy.ne.jp: invalid command" I am having trouble receiving emails due to the account error message.

Can you post a screenshot of your SMTP server settings pane? That may be helpful. A screenshot of the incoming server settings pane may also be useful. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: This was a bug and fixed recently. It happens when there is no default email account defined. click to account settings and one of the accounts must have a star to the right of its name, showing it as default. Set one and I think the problem will go away. Or, upgrade to the latest version.

creator: @next

content:
If this is IMAP, - first click file>offline>download to ensure all message content is downloaded - then, COPY (not move) to a new folder if Local Folders - after reviewing that the messages are safely in Local Folders, you can delete from the IMAP account. - if you want these saved to USB file, then the easiest way is this:

  1. install the addon importexporttools NG
  2. highlight the folder in Local Folders
  3. rightclick and click importexport option to export as mbox and store on USB drive

If you ever want the folder back, just click Local Folders, rightclick and select the importexport option to import mbox.
creator: davidsk

content:
Select the messages, then Ctrl+S, select the target folder, and the messages will be copied as eml files.

To import, add them to a subfolder of Local Folders by drag and drop from File Explorer.

content: Outlook requires OAuth authentication; app passwords no longer work for third-party mail clients, including Thunderbird. You will need to change the authentication type to "OAuth2" and then sign in to Microsoft when prompted. This support article should help as well.
creator: bbonacci

content: Thank you for your reply. I‚Äôm unable to register my Outlook email account itself, so I cannot change the authentication method. I tried entering my regular password instead of an app password, but it didn‚Äôt work.

content: First, pleas do NOT post twice. That only causes confusion and extra work for the volunteers. I am unclear on your question, as cardDAV is for additional addressbooks. Updating those is best done from their source. You can always use just the Thunderbird addressbook.

content: I suggest clicking settings>general and look for the experimental setup option and Untick it. This is a new account setup process that still has bugs. Then, repeat the setup process. See attached screenshot.

content: It will help if you post screenshots of your SMTP server settings pane and the complete text of error message.
creator: davidsk

content:
Try these settings for the outgoing SMTP:

smtp.telkomsa.net, port 25, security = STARTTLS, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address.

https://images.telkom.co.za/backend-files/2024-05/Thunderbird%20Guide_0.pdf?VersionId=hBVF8hFpXpr8E7eUunXh3EudXEHibwJP

If those don't work, try changing the port to 587, the default port for STARTTLS smtp.

content:
A quando risale l'ultimo backup? Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Pi√π che altro se Thunderbird identfica un contenuto remoto significa che l'immagine non √® allegata alla mail ma viene carucata tramite un host. Tuttavia senza vedere il sorgente √® difficile fare ipotesi.

PGP nasce per la cifratura del testo. Ma dato che gli allegati vengono convertiti in sequenze ASCII dovrebbe funzionare comunque.

content:
L'ipotesi che l'immagine sia caricata da un altro host sorgente √® senza dubbio concreta. Ma perch√© Thunderbird non mi offre il bottone per scaricarla comunque? E perch√© se permetto (da configurazione) tutti i contenuti esterni continua a darmi l'errore?

Grazie 1000 per la pronta risposta

content: Aggiungo che TB Android non ha lo stesso problema. La mail viene visualizzata correttamente e non ci sono indicazioni di allegati esterni. Allego screenshot. Grazie
creator: giuseppe.miotti

content:
Questo √® l'idea che mi sono fatto: Dalle immagini del tuo penultimo post sembrerebbe che la cifratura PGP venga applicata solo al testo. Un allegato di 1 MB dovrebbe generare un codice molto pi√π lungo. Ipotizzo allora che Thunderbird (su PC) decifri la parte cifrata del messaggio ma la tratti come un oggetto DOM separato rispetto all'allegato che in quel contesto viene dunque considerato Contenuto remoto. Pu√≤ darsi che sia corretto cos√¨ per ragioni di sicurezza o che si tratti di un bug. A me per√≤ suona strano che Proton permetta di inviare una mail con PGP lasciando per√≤ in chiaro gli allegati. Forse ho inteso male.

Posso chiederti che succede se da Thunderbird+Gmail invii una mail PGP a te stesso (sempre Gmail) senza passare da Proton?

Quanto a Thunderbird per Android, √® letteralmente un altro software con una base di codice completamente differente.
creator: @next

content:
Grazie next - nel penultimo post ho tagliato il file sorgente della mail che era da centinaia di righe, credo che per questo la cifratura PGP appaia incompleta. Ora ho provato con una immagine da 20KB, mandandola con TB alla casella GMAIL da GMAIL stessa (come da te suggerito) - vedi allegato, si vede tutto correttamente senza warning di TB - ma anche mandando la mail da PROTON - TB segnala il warning e lo mette come allegato -. Ti riporto qui di seguito il sorgente dei 2 messaggi (prima TB vs TB poi PROTON vs TB).

    • La form non mi permette di incollare tutto il messaggio, per cui anche stavolta devo tagliare la parte del corpo della mail ** se c'√® un modo di girare tutto il file, fammi sapere per favore **

Ogni messaggio √® preceduto e seguito da una riga di "$" per semplicit√† di ricerca. Grazie ancora per la pazienza e l'indagine.

content:
Quindi da Thunderbird a Thunderbird funziona correttamente mentre da Proton a Thunderbird no, ho capito bene?

A questo punto penso dipenda da come Proton codifichi il messaggio. Come dicevo sopra sembra che l'allegato non venga codificato con PGP. Probabilmente dovresti parlarne con il supporto di Proton e poi eventualmente decidere se segnalarlo come bug di Thunderbird (-> https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/home)

content: Thunderbird uses the account settings you provided and sends your email address and the password you provided when sending mail. The error you see was returned to thunderbird from the email provider's server. Thunderbird is only a messenger. If you post screenshot of your SMTP server settings pane and also of your incoming server settings pane plus complete text of error message, someone here may have some suggestions to assist you. thank you

The web interface (cPanel) shows the folders as a list, not as a nested tree. But if the folder is a subfolder it shows its parent. Inbox, drafts, sent, deleted etc. are peers with no parent. A subfolder of any folder except Inbox shows its parent. A subfolder of Inbox has "..." as parent. If I set up the account in another email client (MS Outlook) the folders appear as the nested tree I expect, with Inbox, drafts, sent etc. as peers and subfolders I create in Inbox nested in one level.

content: I made 2 screen shots (PDF format) of what pops up as I try to get access. However your site will not accept a PDF. Can I save it in some other version that your site will accept? Please advise
creator: vmausser

content:
You need to create image files for images saved in a image format such as jpeg. PDF is not an image file, it's a document which you put the image into. You obviously created an image otherwise you could not have put it into a PDF document. Only image files can be uploaded. Just save image as a jpeg image file and upload it.

You probably never needed to insert password because it was auto saved and the password was always used to access the account. However, many servers have altered how people can access server and some now need secure mail key also known as app generated password. So when we know what server settings you are using we can check it they are correct and also advise on whether the server you use has altered any requirements.

It would also be useful to know whether you are getting any errors because the wording can offere some insight into what is wrong. When you click on 'Get Messages' maybe you get the error pop up - please upload an image of that error.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
I suggest you do this:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  3. if the account is IMAP, click the imapmail folder and then the <imap-account> folder. If POP, click the Mail folder and then the <pop-account> folder
  4. now, click the trash folder and do a screenshot of the contents and post that.

content: Click the trash folder to open it. you can then delete the entries with windows file explorer.
creator: davidsk

content: On second thought, the trash folder itself may be corrupt. Exit thunderbird first and then delete the trash and trash.msf in the profile. to do that - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - exit thunderbird - click to the imapmail\<accountname> folder and delete trash and trash.msf - restart thunderbird

content:
The Date for messages received today shows only the time, by default. It's possible to display the complete date by changing 'mail.ui.display.dateformat.today' to 2 in Config. editor.

https://kb.mozillazine.org/Date_display_format

content:
I'm trying to make sure I fully understand the issue. So please help clarify a few points.

Thunderbird is just a program and there is no such thing as a thunderbird account. In Thunderbird have you created two mail accounts, one for the domain and one for gmail. Is that correct ?

In Thunderbird, the account for the domain email address receives emails, then in webmail accounts you have set up domain emails get auto forwarded to gmail account at which point the emails in domain email address in Thunderbird disappear.

Sounds like you have created an imap mail account for the domain email address. Imap accounts can only display whatever is on server. All Imap folders synchronise with server folders of same name. In effect you are seeing a mirror copy of whatever is on the server. The imap account folders are therefore not truelly independent of the server. In effect emails are stored on server and the imap account faciliates a view of the emails stored on the server.

Then emails get forwarded from domain to gmail, those emails get deleted off the domain server and reappear in the gmail account. At this point, if you logon to the domain webmail account and there are no emails, then nothing is on server. This means - in Thunderbird the imap domain email address Inbox synchronises with server and now shows exactly whatever is on server which is nothing. This is to be expected.

If you want to download emails from your domain into a Thunderbird mail account and keep a copy after all those emails have been deleted off the server - (they got sent to gmail), you will need to create a new mail account in Thunderbird for the domain email address but this time set it up as a POP mail account with Account Settings > Server Settings option to 'Leave messages on server' so that email copies remain on server and can then forward to gmail. Pop mail accounts only get access to the server Inbox and can download whatever is in the Inbox. They do not synchronise with server, email are stored in files that are completely independent of the server.
creator: Toad-Hall

Then people here can guide you in copying folders to Thunderbird if you want help with that.
